The Lord has instructed me that this is the work to be done by those conducting our restaurants. The pressure and rush of business must not lead to a neglect of the work of soul-saving. It is well to 


                                                                109 

minister to the physical wants of our fellow-men, but if ways are not found to let the light of the gospel shine forth to those who come day by day for their meals, how is God glorified by our work?  {TSDF 108.10}  
     When the restaurant work was started, it was expected that it would be the means of reaching many with the message of present truth. Has it done this?
